alert.note: Alert for Clay; Lowndes; Oktibbeha; Webster (Mississippi) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued February 23 at 3:14AM CST until February 23 at 6:15AM CST by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 AM CST THIS MORNING FOR NORTHEASTERN WEBSTER, CLAY, CENTRAL LOWNDES AND OKTIBBEHA COUNTIES... At 314 AM CST, Doppler radar indicated additional heavy rain moving into the warned area. Between 2 and 5 inches of rain have fallen, and another inch of rain could fall in the next couple of hours. Flash flooding is ongoing in some locations, particularly in the Starkville to Columbus area. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Starkville, Columbus, West Point, Montpelier, Columbus AFB, Caledonia, Maben, Muldrow, Tibbee, Griffith, Pala Alto, Sessums, Pheba, Bent Oak, Waverly, Longview, Kolola Springs, Steens, Artesia and Sturgis. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1 INCH IN 2 HOURS
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
